GeoTIFF Demo HOW-TO¶

The geobatch-demo project uses GeoBatch to convert a bulk of GeoTIFFs files to tiled GeoTIFFs with overviews and publish them on GeoServer

Installing geobatch-demo¶

if you haven’t already done, setup the GEOBATCH_CONFIG_DIR and make sure that you have setted the corresponding environment variable (see installation chapter).

Locate into GeoBatch deployment the folder WEB-INF/data/

Copy the folder geotiff and the file geotiff.xml and paste into your GEOBATCH_CONFIG_DIR

Download one or many .tiff fi les for example usage.

Note

For a correct download for each file click on the link and in the following window click on raw button. Remember to replace dot(.) with underscore(_). Please dont’t download the file right clicking on the link and selecting save as. The downloaded file may be corrupt.

Create in a location of your choice output and backup directories:

$ mkdir output_tiff
$ mkdir output_backup

Edit the geobatch-demo flow configuration under /GEOBATCH_CONFIG_DIR/geotiff.xml. There, edit:

  • geoserverURL pointing a running geoserver.

create a workspace named it_geosolutions

Running¶

  1. Start tomcat via startup.sh.
  2. Go to http://localhost:8080/geobatch/flows.do You should see a stopped geotiff. Start it.
  3. Put one or many raster files into geotiff/in directory.
  4. Check the instances tab to see how they run.
  5. Access to geoserver and verify that a new GeoTIFF (or many) is published.

you should see the workspace it_geosolutions with the layer world_200403_3x5400x2700

this is the layer you have published through geostore viewed in openlayers
